annotation.spannedText: The universality of Disneyland may make parents feel more vulnerable in a “this could happen to us” way

classMention.mentionClass: The universality of Disneyland may make parents feel more vulnerable in a “this could happen to us” way

annotation.spannedText: the Disneyland outbreak could shift both the social norms around vaccine refusal and the framing of the importance of childhood immunization

classMention.mentionClass: the Disneyland outbreak could shift both the social norms around vaccine refusal and the framing of the importance of childhood immunization

annotation.spannedText: This could in theory produce more “something must be done about this” sentiment that could then lead, for example, to stricter state vaccine exemption laws

classMention.mentionClass: This could in theory produce more “something must be done about this” sentiment that could then lead, for example, to stricter state vaccine exemption laws

annotation.spannedText: this recent outbreak very simply plays on inherent present bias—our tendency as humans to heavily discount future costs and benefits of a decision or behavior while overweighting current costs and benefits

classMention.mentionClass: this recent outbreak very simply plays on inherent present bias—our tendency as humans to heavily discount future costs and benefits of a decision or behavior while overweighting current costs and benefits

annotation.spannedText: For most parents, the benefits of vaccinating are intangible (we take an action so that something doesn’t happen), probabilistic (vaccines are not 100% effective, and the chances of being exposed to measles are small), and in the future

classMention.mentionClass: For most parents, the benefits of vaccinating are intangible (we take an action so that something doesn’t happen), probabilistic (vaccines are not 100% effective, and the chances of being exposed to measles are small), and in the future

annotation.spannedText: It’s reasonable to imagine why parents with any level of concern about vaccines might opt out

classMention.mentionClass: It’s reasonable to imagine why parents with any level of concern about vaccines might opt out

annotation.spannedText: The Disneyland outbreak shifts this calculus by making the cost of not vaccinating very immediate and tangible, and might therefore lead to decreased refusal

classMention.mentionClass: The Disneyland outbreak shifts this calculus by making the cost of not vaccinating very immediate and tangible, and might therefore lead to decreased refusal

annotation.spannedText: While the Disneyland outbreak is getting a lot of coverage now, this will likely last for only a few more news cycles

classMention.mentionClass: While the Disneyland outbreak is getting a lot of coverage now, this will likely last for only a few more news cycles

annotation.spannedText: the parents whose vaccine beliefs and behaviors are most likely to be affected by this outbreak are the slightly hesitant and the undecided

classMention.mentionClass: the parents whose vaccine beliefs and behaviors are most likely to be affected by this outbreak are the slightly hesitant and the undecided

annotation.spannedText: We are not likely to see much shift in the more adamant, hard-core anti-vaccine folks

classMention.mentionClass: We are not likely to see much shift in the more adamant, hard-core anti-vaccine folks

annotation.spannedText: they have skewed the facts in favor of trying to sell people more pharmaceuticals

classMention.mentionClass: they have skewed the facts in favor of trying to sell people more pharmaceuticals

annotation.spannedText: a non-vaccinating parent in Los Angeles

classMention.mentionClass: a non-vaccinating parent in Los Angeles

annotation.spannedText: The same facts about the outbreak that might convince a moderately hesitant parent to vaccinate will only reinforce previously-held beliefs in a strongly anti-vaccine parent

classMention.mentionClass: The same facts about the outbreak that might convince a moderately hesitant parent to vaccinate will only reinforce previously-held beliefs in a strongly anti-vaccine parent

annotation.spannedText: these beliefs and the vaccine-refusing behaviors that accompany them tend to cluster socially and spatially–and it is this very clustering that leads to outbreak “hot spots” where herd immunity is most compromised

classMention.mentionClass: these beliefs and the vaccine-refusing behaviors that accompany them tend to cluster socially and spatially–and it is this very clustering that leads to outbreak “hot spots” where herd immunity is most compromised

annotation.spannedText: Let’s not let any more trips to Disneyland be ruined by Mickey Mouse science

classMention.mentionClass: Let’s not let any more trips to Disneyland be ruined by Mickey Mouse science
